title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 June 2016 - XWiki
content:
<sdumitriu1> has quit  
03:22 <sdumitriu1> has joined #xwiki  
03:43 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
06:34 <M-oren> has joined #xwiki  
06:34 <M-oren> hello  
06:35 <M-oren> just signed up for vector  
06:35 <M-oren> i have no idea what is this and what am i suppose to do here  
06:35 <M-oren> i also like wikis  
06:35 <M-oren> so i joined this room (;  
06:37 <M-fs\_IVJRUkJ3d2V> has joined #xwiki  
06:37 <M-fs\_IVJRUkJ3d2V> has left #xwiki  
07:04 <M-oren> has left #xwiki  
07:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:10 <vmassol> has quit  
08:28 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:28 <cjd> has quit  
08:41 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:45 <Evi> has joined #xwiki  
08:50 <Evi> hey hey! Concing the Info Macro: Has anyone a clue how to modify the styling of the box? I would like to change it from blue to grey. Here http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Info+Macro it says that it depends on the skin. I tried out to change the @brand-info color, but it had no effect.  
09:26 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <M-oren> has joined #xwiki  
09:33 <M-oren> so. what's xwiki?  
09:33 <M-oren> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome ?  
09:48 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:06 <tmortagne> M-oren: yes as indicated in the chat description this is about https://www.xwiki.org  
10:10 <acotiuga> Hello  
10:11 <M-oren> nice!  
10:11 <M-oren> how do i sent message to a person?  
10:11 <M-oren> with @?  
10:14 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <vmassol> you don't :)  
10:14 <vmassol> if you have a question related to XWiki you send it here to everyone  
10:15 <M-oren> is it not possible to send a message to someone (expect for private chat)?  
10:15 <cjd> if you start the message off with their name, they will be more likely to see it  
10:16 <M-oren> cjd ok (:  
10:16 <cjd> but that's only useful if there are 2 conversations going on  
10:16 <cjd> otherwise it can be rude  
10:17 <M-fs\_IVJRUkJ3d2V> has joined #xwiki  
10:17 <M-oren> i am playing with every button here  
10:17 <cjd> you know the type: "mom, mom, mom, mom, mom look, mom look, mom look" ...  
10:17 <M-oren> (:  
10:17 <M-fs\_IVJRUkJ3d2V> has left #xwiki  
10:25 <acotiuga> has quit  
11:26 <cjd> has quit  
11:45 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
13:15 <vmassol> has quit  
13:24 <fitz> has joined #xwiki  
13:39 <Evi> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <Evi> Hi, I wanna change the color of the info box. I tried out skin -> @brand-info. But it doesn't change anything.  
14:15 <tmortagne> has quit  
14:48 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
15:54 <ImRG> has joined #xwiki  
15:54 <ImRG> Hi  
15:54 <ImRG> Is there a shortcut for code macro ?  
15:57 <ImRG> In the wysiwyg editor that's a lot of clic and popup windows, I'm wondering if there's a way to setup xwiki so you select text, Ctrl-Shift-something and that's a {{code}} bloc  
16:05 <ImRG> has quit  
16:06 <ImRGGG> has joined #xwiki  
16:25 <ClemensR> ImRGGG : sorry, as far as I know there is none. I usually type in "code" in the Macro selection window, that is a little less clicks ... but macros have no hotkeys, as far as I know  
16:26 <ImRGGG> Thank for the answer ClemensR. Maybe there's a way to stick a shortcut in the wysiwyg toolbar ?  
16:28 <ClemensR> hmmm .. with the current editor, that is the good old  Google GWT editor,  which needs java code to be extended ...  
16:28 <ClemensR> mayeb one can add hooks via a JavaScript extension ; the JS Api (beside more stuff) is here http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/WYSIWYG+Editor+Module  
16:29 <ClemensR> the new editor is based on CKEditor and should be easier to extend  
16:30 <ClemensR> it is available as an extension, see here:  extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CKEditor+Integration  but extensibility is fom the admin UI is yet to be implemented  
17:02 <Evi> has quit  
17:13 <ImRGGG> thanks again for the intel ClemensR, I'll do with that :-)  
17:13 <ClemensR> I hope you can get something working, ImRGGG , I guess it is currently not a trivial task  
17:22 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:24 <ClemensR> has left #xwiki  
17:34 <ImRGGG> has quit  
17:36 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
17:45 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
17:46 <vmassol> has quit  
17:49 <vmassol1> has quit  
17:49 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:54 <vmassol> has quit  
18:21 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
18:43 <fitz> has quit  
18:46 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
18:52 <M-oren> anyone know of open source wiki that is using markdown with support for wysiwyg and also authentication?  
18:52 <M-oren> https://github.com/gollum/gollum is very close but got no auth built in  
18:54 <cjd> XWiki supports markdown and WYSIWYG but not at the same time (WYSIWYG depends on XWiki syntax)  
18:54 <vmassol> cjd@  
18:54 <vmassol> actually it kind of does  
18:54 <cjd> oh cool  
18:54 <vmassol> I coded the start of a markdown renderer  
18:54 <cjd> :D  
18:54 <cjd> excellent  
18:54 <vmassol> and it works in the wysiwyg :)  
18:55 <cjd> that seems to be a big deal for Open Source people  
18:55 <M-oren> xwiki is not open source?  
18:55 <vmassol> yup that's why I started it  
18:55 <cjd> and for macros and stuff, you're just making it up as you go ?  
18:55 <cjd> M-oren: XWiki is indeed Open Source  
18:55 <vmassol> that works  
18:55 <vmassol> (macros)  
18:55 <cjd> I mean the spec, you're just making one up ?  
18:56 <cjd> because markdown doesn't really have macros  
18:56 <vmassol> yep we extended it, see http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Markdown+Syntaxes/  
18:56 <cjd> makes sense  
18:57 <vmassol> if you install version 8.2 of that extension it should work with the WYSIWYG editor  
18:57 <cjd> also OnlyOffice is really really good  
18:57 <cjd> been reverse-engineering this week  
18:58 <cjd> 3mn lines of javascript, 38k lines of comments xD  
18:58 <cjd> but I have not spotted a bug yet  
18:58 <vmassol> 3M lines of js, wow!, I wouldn't want to maintain that  
18:59 <vmassol> that's larger than XWiki  
18:59 <cjd> They have a definite process and they're clearly C++ developers from their style  
18:59 <cjd> I'd say they've been on large projects before this one  
19:00 <M-oren> vmassol (IRC): it took me 2 minutes to click around until i found the github repositories. it would be valuable to have a link 'fork me' on the upper right side to github  
19:01 <cjd> unfortunately the magical converter which turns Word/Excel/Powerpoint files into their binary format is just an executable w/ no source code, there's an issue for this: https://github.com/ONLYOFFICE/DocumentServer/issues/10  
19:02 <vmassol> M-oren: you mean the "Source" button?  
19:03 <vmassol> it's a good idea: we'd need to decide how to handle more precisely the special case of github then, vs other sources, what to do with the button, etc. Right now this is a generic app that works with any source, not just github  
19:04 <M-oren> i am talking about link to the source code  
19:04 <M-oren> i didn't realize it's open source  
19:04 <M-oren> it looks 'corporate'  
19:04 <vmassol> what looks corporate? the "Source" button?  
19:04 <M-oren> not something that allows me to play with easily  
19:05 <M-oren> the design of the homepage  
19:05 <vmassol> what home page?  
19:05 <evalica> has quit  
19:05 <vmassol> this page http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Markdown+Syntaxes/ or this page: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/syntax-markdown/syntax-markdown-markdown11 ?  
19:05 <vmassol> or some other page?  
19:05 <M-oren> http://www.xwiki.org/  
19:05 <vmassol> actuallty the link is broken ;)  
19:06 <vmassol> ahhhh  
19:06 <vmassol> you switched context  
19:06 <M-oren> oh. sorry!  
19:06 <vmassol> interesting  
19:07 <vmassol> thank you for this because that's exactly what we want it to be ;)  
19:07 <vmassol> to look corporate  
19:08 <vmassol> it's a wiki for the enterprise :)  
19:08 <M-oren> oh  
19:08 <vmassol> re whether it's open source or not, the title says "The Advanced Open Source Enterprise Wiki" so that should answer it, no?  
19:09 <vmassol> but indeed  
19:09 <vmassol> the fork me on github idea is good  
19:09 <vmassol> I think Caty wanted that too  
19:09 <vmassol> I remembe seeing at some point on xwiki.org  
19:09 <Enygma`> has quit  
19:09 <vmassol> ah it's here:  
19:09 <vmassol> on the dev subwiki  
19:09 <vmassol> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/WebHome  
19:10 <vmassol> so when you click on "Contribute" and then "Development" you get there  
19:14 <Slashman> has quit  
19:14 <M-oren> also installation should be 1 line - docker run xwiki/wiki or something similar  
19:14 <M-oren> example: https://hub.docker.com/r/suttang/gollum/  
19:16 <vmassol> M-oren: this is an open source project, feel free to contribute to make it better! :)  
19:16 <vmassol> FYI not everyone is using docker  
19:16 <M-oren> WHAT? not everyone??? (:  
19:16 <vmassol> right now it's as simple as unzipping  
19:17 <vmassol> now  
19:17 <vmassol> I started this: https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/docker-xwiki/tree/VERSION2  
19:17 <M-oren> nice! let me try that  
19:25 <tmortagne> M-oren: "installation should be 1 line" you have the one line installation on Debian with apt-get  
19:33 <M-oren> ok. i'll try the docker first  
19:44 <vmassol> mflorea: something strange  
19:44 <vmassol> I tried to edit http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/Registration with the GWT wysiwyg editor  
19:44 <vmassol> I get the full UI  
19:44 <vmassol> haven't investigated yet  
19:44 <vmassol> (I'm preparing my demo for the web2day conference)  
19:45 <vmassol> FTR I get https://www.evernote.com/l/AHc00p4hp2tG3pu-KhfBt44NqhD0xX-t\_l0  
19:45 <vmassol> probably caused by a redirect  
19:56 <vmassol> btw guys, Go To Page still shows WebHome…  
19:56 <vmassol> do we have a jira issue for this?  
20:25 <cjd> has quit  
20:27 <mflorea> vmassol: for the redirect see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-4211  
20:28 <tmortagne> has quit  
20:34 <vmassol> mflorea: ah yes ;)  
21:12 <M-oren> vmassol (IRC): there is no docker-compose.yml file i am trying docker built -t wiki .  
21:12 <M-oren> vmassol (IRC): there is no docker-compose.yml file so i am trying docker build -t wiki .  
21:22 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
22:26 <M-oren> worked. now i tried 'docker run -p 8080:8080 wiki' and i see 'It works !' on my browser. not sure where to go from here  
22:34 <mflorea> has quit  
22:35 <vmassol> has quit  
22:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
22:54 <vmassol> has quit  
23:50 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
23:52 <vmassol> has quit  
{{/code}}
